quizzes.question: What types of color values can NOT be used within the linear gradient property?

Add the missing color stop value to create sharp lines between the colors.
[!raw!]
background: linear-gradient
     (red 20%, green {0}, green 80%, blue 80%);
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Color Stops[/h1]

Colors can be added one after the other, separated with a comma. The browser will then determine each color stop position.
In the example below, the linear gradient has multiple color stops and runs from top to bottom. [code format="css" codeId="600"]background:-moz-linear-gradient([b]blue[/b], [b]yellow[/b], [b]green[/b], [b]pink[/b], [b]white[/b]);[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2688" width="100%"]
Color stop positions can be specified for each color.[code format="css" codeId="601"]background:-moz-linear-gradient([b]blue 20%[/b], [b]yellow 30%[/b], [b]green 85%[/b]);[/code]
[b]Result:[/b] [img id="2689" width="100%"]
[note]In addition to percentages, you can also use [b]px[/b], [b]em[/b], and so on, to specify the color stops.
If you use the same color stop position for two colors, a sharp line will be created between them.[/note]

quizzes.question: Which one of the following directions is not supported for the linear-gradient?

linear-gradient (left, red, yellow);
Which one of the following choices is equivalent to the example above?
Which property is correct for creating a repeating gradient?
quizzes.textContent:
[h1]Repeating a Linear-Gradient[/h1]

The [b]repeating-linear-gradient()[/b] function is used to repeat a linear gradient: [code format="css" codeId="604"]background:-moz-[b]repeating-linear-gradient[/b](blue, green 20px);[/code]
[b]Result: [/b][img id="2692" width="100%"]
